instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.P5VS0_EN: What is P5VS0_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_S0 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.P3V3S0_EN: What is P3V3S0_EN? This signal enables the PP3V3_S0 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.P1V8S3_PGOOD: What is P1V8S3_PGOOD? P1V8S3_PGOOD is a signal that denotes that the PP1V8_S3 power rail is working..
definitions.P5VS4RS3_PGOOD: What is P5VS4RS3_PGOOD? P5VS4RS3_PGOOD is a signal that confirms the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail is working properly. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 0.11A draw,  S0 Rails present but not turning on.
threads.message:
Hi Guys,

I am having Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> which has no obvious liquid damage. Seems like decided to die out of nowhere
I can feel the board warms up such as its working but no fanspin or USB activity.

Not sure in what order to provide readings so just grabbed an example from other posts. Let me know if you like me to provide more

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 5.16V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.41v
<SIGNAL>PP5VP3V3_VREF2</SIGNAL> = 2.02v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_BUF_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>P1V8S3_PGOOD</SIGNAL> = 0.186V
<SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_PGOOD</SIGNAL> = 0.186V
<SIGNAL>P1V05S0_PGOOD</SIGNAL> = 0.186V
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = 0.186V
<SIGNAL>P5VS0_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>P3V3S0_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> = 3.349V

Haven't seen anything like this.
Any input would be appreciated.

Cheers

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 0.11A draw,  S0 Rails present but not turning on.
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

"<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = 0.186V"
All the other mentioned power good signals met there; no need to specify them anymore.

One power supply from S3, or S0 state has missing voltage, or its power good fails somehow.
Post the voltage on all big coils, as first step.
Also check <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> for corrosion.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 0.11A draw,  S0 Rails present but not turning on.
threads.message:
Thanks for the speedy reply.

All big coil voltages seemed alright apart CPU Phase ones, hence skipped them. Here they are:
L7630 - <SIGNAL>PP1V05S0_LL</SIGNAL> = 1.06V
L7430 - <SIGNAL>PDDR_S3_REG_L</SIGNAL> = 1.21V
L7560 - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG_L</SIGNAL> = 3.35V
L7520 - <SIGNAL>P5V_S4RS3_REG_L</SIGNAL> = 5.17V
L7130 - <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHRGR_REG</SIGNAL> = 8.59V

L7320 - <SIGNAL>CPUVR_PHASE2</SIGNAL> = 0.01V
L7310 - <SIGNAL>CPUVR_PHASE1</SIGNAL> = 0.01V

No Corrosion on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q8159</TRANSISTOR>, replaced them just in case still same response. 

Poked around <CHIP>U1930</CHIP>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3V
I wonder where <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is drained.

Thanks again.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 0.11A draw,  S0 Rails present but not turning on.
threads.message:
You can try removing <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> first; is a redundant protection, not really needed.
Next, remove power good resistors, one by one; keep <RESISTOR>R8167</RESISTOR> in place!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 0.11A draw,  S0 Rails present but not turning on.
threads.message:
That was brilliant 2informaticos. Thank you very much.

<SIGNAL>P1V8S3_PGOOD</SIGNAL> - after <RESISTOR>R8166</RESISTOR> removed and line was fluctuating around 0.5V
<SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_PGOOD</SIGNAL> - after <RESISTOR>R8165</RESISTOR> removed and line was fluctuating around 0.5V
<SIGNAL>P1V05S0_PGOOD</SIGNAL> - After <RESISTOR>R8164</RESISTOR> removed the fan spins. Resoldered it back all working. 

Not sure what have caused it but <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> seems to be okay. I wonder why it was not sending PGOOD signal and instead was pulling <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> down. it had around 0.3Vdc


Thanks again.
